title: Why did you overhaul AP items when they were a lot more diverse than AD items?
body: Adc itemization is far worse than AP itemization (in terms of diversity). I'm just curious as to why the effort was made to rework the AP items instead.

replies.body: AP items being in a better spot already was actually one of the key reasons we chose to work on them first. One of the things we wanted to do with the first set of items we overhauled like this was to try and prove some theories we could then apply to future item work. Starting with a set of items that were in a better spot and where we had a better understanding of what did and didn't work was valuable as a result. If these AP changes pan out as hoped (we're still mid assessment at the moment) we'll then look at what we can do with the other categories of itemization.

Lemme ask this now: Are there any changes planned for Essence Reaver {{item:3508}} ? The item is a novel concept, but its implementation right now is absolutely terrible. Bad build path, and its lifesteal component means it's being balanced around competing with {{item:3072}}{{item:3153}} {{item:3074}} , a fight it simply can't win.

Honestly, I feel like if the lifesteal were removed and replaced with some flat ArPen, ER would be a better item as a whole.
When we get to AD items we'll definitely do some work on Essence Reaver (adjust it to make it a better choice or replace it with something more useful, not sure which yet).

If Essence Reaver is supposed to be useful for AD casters (which is the item's sole purpose) then let it _be_ useful.
